DataElement.preferredName: Person North American Association of Central Cancer Registries Ethnic Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text description related to the ethnic groups of a person official written in North American Association of Central Cancer Registries(NAACCR).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person North American Association of Central Cancer Registries Ethnic Group
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the ethnic groups of a person official written in North American Association of Central Cancer Registries(NAACCR).

Property.preferredName: North American Association of Central Cancer Registries Ethnic Group
Property.preferredDefinition: A professional organization that develops and promotes uniform data standards for cancer registration; provides education and training; certifies population-based registries; aggregates and publishes data from central cancer registries; and promotes the use of cancer surveillance data and systems for cancer control and epidemiologic research, public health programs, and patient care to reduce the burden of cancer in North America.:A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition that is maintained from generation to generation. Members share a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group. They have similar and distinctive features in their lifestyle habits and shared experiences. They often have a common genetic heritage which may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.

Concepts.longName: North American Association of Central Cancer Registries
Concepts.definition: A professional organization that develops and promotes uniform data standards for cancer registration; provides education and training; certifies population-based registries; aggregates and publishes data from central cancer registries; and promotes the use of cancer surveillance data and systems for cancer control and epidemiologic research, public health programs, and patient care to reduce the burden of cancer in North America.

A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition that is maintained from generation to generation. Members share a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group. They have similar and distinctive features in their lifestyle habits and shared experiences. They often have a common genetic heritage which may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.
